page.title: 05FARMING IN CHURCHILL
page.content: The land is suitable for growing wheat and barley and each farm grows as much as it can. One has oilseed rape and sometimes peas as "break" crops to give a more balanced rotation. The second has a herd of 120 milking cows, all Holstein Friesians, and rears its own replacement heifers. They graze on grass leys in the summer, but are kept inside for the six winter months and fed mainly on silage. A small acreage is made into hay. The third is also a stud farm and has 3 stallions. Through the summer as many as 130 mares will have their foals there, and then stay on for 12 weeks or so until they are safely in foal again.
